animals.name: Eastern Gray Squirrel
animals.description: A common tree squirrel native to North America, known for its bushy tail and gray fur.
fun_facts: They can leap up to 10 times their body length.
They communicate using a variety of vocalizations.

breeding_info.description: Breeding occurs in late winter to early spring, often in cozy tree nests or leafy dens.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Males engage in acrobatic displays and chase each other to attract females.
breeding_info.nurturing: Mothers care for the young in nests made from twigs and leaves.

animals.name: White-tailed Deer
animals.description: A medium-sized deer characterized by its white tail and adaptability to various habitats.
fun_facts: They can run up to 30 miles per hour.
White-tailed deer are highly social animals.

breeding_info.description: Breeding season occurs in the fall, with males competing fiercely for females in spectacular displays.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Males use scent marking and vocalizations to attract mates.
breeding_info.nurturing: Females conceal fawns in dense cover to protect them from predators.

animals.name: American Bullfrog
animals.description: A large frog known for its deep croak and voracious appetite.
fun_facts: They can eat prey as large as themselves.
American bullfrogs are known for their loud calls.

breeding_info.description: Breeding occurs in spring, with males calling to attract females to shallow waters.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Males are highly territorial and use vocal displays to ward off competitors.
breeding_info.nurturing: Females lay eggs in clusters among vegetation, providing a safe nursery for tadpoles.

animals.name: Eastern Box Turtle
animals.description: A terrestrial turtle recognized for its high-domed shell and long lifespan.
fun_facts: They can live for over 100 years.
Eastern box turtles can retract completely into their shells.

breeding_info.description: Mating occurs in spring and summer, often in sunny areas where turtles can bask.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Males may nudge and bite at the female's shell during courtship.
breeding_info.nurturing: Females bury their eggs in soft soil, returning to the same nesting sites each year.

animals.name: Turkey Vulture
animals.description: A large bird of prey known for its scavenging habits and distinctive appearance.
fun_facts: They have an excellent sense of smell.
Turkey vultures can soar for hours without flapping their wings.

breeding_info.description: Breeding occurs in the spring, with nests typically found on cliffs or in trees.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Males display impressive soaring and puffing up to attract mates.
breeding_info.nurturing: Both parents share incubation duties and feed chicks with regurgitated food.

animals.name: Black Vulture
animals.description: A scavenging bird that is often found in open areas, known for its dark plumage.
fun_facts: They often work in groups to find food.
Black vultures can be aggressive in protecting their territory.

breeding_info.description: Breeding takes place in the spring, often in large communal roosts that offer safety and social interaction.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: They engage in synchronized flight displays to strengthen pair bonds.
breeding_info.nurturing: Nests are typically built in tree cavities or on cliffs, where both parents help rear the chicks.

animals.name: Eastern Wolf
animals.description: A subspecies of the gray wolf, known for its distinctive appearance and social structure.
fun_facts: They have a complex social structure.
Eastern wolves are known for their vocalizations.

breeding_info.description: Breeding occurs in winter, with a close-knit pack structure that helps raise the young.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Only the dominant pair breed, ensuring that the strongest genes are passed on.
breeding_info.nurturing: Pups are cared for by all pack members, who bring food to the den and help protect them.

animals.name: Black Bear
animals.description: A medium-sized bear known for its adaptability and intelligence.
fun_facts: They can run at speeds up to 30 miles per hour.
Black bears are excellent climbers.

breeding_info.description: Breeding occurs in summer, with a fascinating delayed implantation process that optimizes timing.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Males display strength and dominance to attract females.
breeding_info.nurturing: Cubs are born blind and helpless, relying entirely on their mother for warmth and nourishment.

plants.name: Eastern Red Cedar
plants.description: A hardy evergreen tree known for its aromatic wood and vibrant blue berries.
fun_facts: Its wood is resistant to decay.
Eastern red cedar can live for over 100 years.

breeding_info.description: Reproduces through both seed and vegetative propagation, ensuring a wide distribution.
breeding_info.seed_dispersal: Fruits are eaten by birds, helping to spread seeds.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Male trees produce pollen, which is dispersed by wind.
breeding_info.nurturing: Seedlings establish in various soil types, adapting to their environment.

plants.name: Sugar Maple
plants.description: A large tree famous for its brilliant fall colors and sap used to make maple syrup.
fun_facts: Sugar maples can grow over 100 feet tall.
The tree can live for 300 years or more.

breeding_info.description: Reproduces through seeds that are dispersed by wind and water.
breeding_info.seed_dispersal: Seeds are carried by the wind and often germinate in rich soil.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Trees are mostly self-pollinating but can cross-pollinate.
breeding_info.nurturing: Seedlings require ample sunlight to thrive and grow.

plants.name: Black-Eyed Susan
plants.description: A vibrant wildflower known for its yellow petals and dark brown center.
fun_facts: They attract a variety of pollinators.
Black-eyed Susans are often used in ornamental gardens.

breeding_info.description: Reproduces primarily through seeds, with a high germination rate under suitable conditions.
breeding_info.seed_dispersal: Seeds are spread by wind and animals.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Pollination occurs through wind and insect activity.
breeding_info.nurturing: Seedlings establish quickly, often competing with other plants for light.

plants.name: Common Milkweed
plants.description: A perennial plant known for attracting monarch butterflies and producing distinctive pods.
fun_facts: Milkweed sap can be toxic to some animals.
It plays a crucial role in the life cycle of monarchs.

breeding_info.description: Reproduces through seeds and vegetative growth, thriving in disturbed areas.
breeding_info.mating_window: Blooming occurs from late spring to summer.
breeding_info.seed_dispersal: Seeds are carried by wind due to their fluffy structure.
breeding_info.mating_behavior: Pollination occurs primarily through insects, especially bees.
breeding_info.nurturing: Plants establish quickly in nutrient-rich soils and tolerate drought.
